content.description: This route climbs a brilliant white shallow dihedral. The crux is getting established in the dihedral but funkiness is yet to come. There are two exit strategies to reach the anchors. Don't forget to let out a "Rebel Yell" when you successfully reach the anchors.
content.protection: Rebel Yell is currently a top rope but should bolted soon as a sport climb with 4 to 5 bolts.
content.location: Rebel Yell is located above the lower slabs. It is an extension to Safety Ledge or Snake Charmer.

climbs.name: Bullistics
climbs.fa: Ben Dunlap, Steve Pope and Terry Wright (mid 80's)- Established Trad                                     Retro-bolted by: Ryan Beasley

content.description: Follow the strenuous layback crack in the dihedral while smearing and stemming to an awkward finish.
content.protection: This route was originally established as a traditional route with an R rating near the finish. Thanks to the good graces of Steve Pope it is now equipped with 4 lead bolts and anchors. It is a route everyone can enjoy and is quite the crowd pleaser.
content.location: Bullistics is located above Snake Charmer. It is an extension to any of the lower slab routes.

content.description: Air Mantle is an alternate finish to Ain't this a Mess. Move left at the end of the fingertip layback crack.
content.protection: A piton protects the exit move but it is necessary to complete the Air Mantle move to reach the piton. Currently this route has new anchors. This route should be equipped soon as a bolted sport route. Thanks to the approval of the first ascent party.
content.location: Alternate finish to Ain't this a Mess.

content.description: Finger crack/layback which follows the dihedral above and to the right of Safety Ledge (5.9).
content.protection: Bolts to two bolt anchor. There is also a two bolt anchor at the base of the climb on the ledge above Safety Ledge.
content.location: Can be climbed as an extension of Safety Ledge (5.9), or split into a separate pitch.

content.description: Start off the Ledge above Lightning Crack and follow a layback corner system passing an old piton to thin fingers then move right to anchors.
content.protection: Trad and 1 pin to anchors. It is possible that this route might be retro-bolted into a sport route.
content.location: Ain't this a Mess is located on the ledge above Lightning Crack.
